thread.title: Report: Lamar Odom took two sex supplements FDA calls dangerous
thread.title_full: Report: Lamar Odom took two sex supplements FDA calls dangerous

author:
Compiled by Tony Hicks

thicks@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Report: Lamar Odom took two sex supplements FDA calls dangerous
text:
Lamar Odom found unconscious at Nevada brothel A government agency issued warnings about the herbal supplements Lamar Odom was taking before he collapsed Tuesday at a Nevada brothel, saying they're dangerous. 
As the estranged husband of Khloe Kardashian remains in a coma Thursday in a Las Vegas hospital, investigators say Odom ingested cocaine and 10 tablets of "sexual performance enhancer supplements" during his days-long stay at the Love Ranch, said Nye County Sheriff Sharon Wehrly, according to the Washington Post. 
Brothel owner Dennis Hof told the Post the former NBA star bought "herbal Viagra" at the brothel. This image dated May 11, 2011, shows Lamar Odom answering questions about the Los Angeles Lakers. (Allen J. Schaben/Los Angeles Times/TNS) 
"It's called 'Reload," said Hof. "It's an herbal supplement that gives you energy, They say it's for erectile dysfunction. Basically, it gives you more energy. It's an over-the-counter speedy kind of product ... the pill form of an energy drink. It's not a pharmaceutical, not a prescription drug." 
The Food and Drug Administration said two years ago Reload (which is the brand name) "contains (a) hidden drug ingredient" that could lead to dangerous reactions. 
According to the Post, the FDA said Reload was basically Viagra without medical oversight. "FDA laboratory analysis confirmed that 'Reload' contains sildenafil, the active ingredient in the FDA-approved prescription drug Viagra, used to treat erectile dysfunction (ED)," the 2013 warning said. "This undeclared ingredient may interact with nitrates found in some prescription drugs such as nitroglycerin and may lower blood pressure to dangerous levels. Consumers should stop using this product immediately and throw it away." Advertisement 
A Love Ranch spokesman told the Associated Press that Odom also bought Libimax Plus, another brand of sexual enhancement supplement, at the brothel's shop. The FDA has targeted the brand, saying it contains a powerful prescription drug not on the label. The drug was recalled in 2009 because of the hidden contents, the Post said. Odom -- who starred for the Los Angeles Lakers and Los Angeles Clippers, among other teams -- was found unconscious Tuesday morning on the floor of a room he'd occupied at the Love Ranch since Saturday. Tony Hicks writes celebrity commentary for the Bay Area News Group. Contact him at Facebook.com/BayAreaNewsGroup.TonyHicks or Twitter.com/tonyhicks67
